reviews.text: We only had time for a one night , but wish we could have stayed longer. The staff here is so friendly and helpful. Everyone we encountered seemed genuinely concerned that we enjoy our stay. It was amazing! First they checked weather reports (more snow on the way), gave us maps and walking paths, and many suggestions, dinner ideas, more directions, etc. With each visit to the front desk, we never felt like we were taking up too much of their time (all this and the hotel was fully booked!)
reviews.title: Lovely hotel, nicest staff, great location!

reviews.text: The rooms were fine (standard size). The hotel decor doesn't look or feel like a typical Courtyard Marriott. It's really a step above. Free wireless in the room was helpful (especially b/c of
reviews.title: Great Hotel

likes.liked: — location, friendly staff and resonable rates

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: the travel conditions).
reviews.title: Great hotel

reviews.text: There's no need to pay more to stay within the Old Quebec walled city. You can see the wall & entrance from the hotel. Into Old Quebec, you can walk to all the restaurants, shops, toboggan run @ Chateau Frontenac. Behind the hotel, you can walk (toward a Parliment bldg) where there is a street full of restaurants. In winter, there's a small rink right outside the hotel's front door.
reviews.title: Great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We drove 20 minutes to Valcartier (vacation village). It is the most UNBELIEVABLE tubing park you can imagine. For more video, type Valcartier on YouTube. Lots of people have posted videoes of the different tubing runs. It's a nice change of pace from museums, shops, and culture, especially if you are traveling with teenagers.
reviews.title: Great Staff and Location
Lovely hotel with friendly staff
reviews.text: We arrived at night and were greeted by very friendly staff, which gave us a great first impression. When we were shown our room and we looked out the window we were absolutely delighted by the amazing view (try to get rooms numbered 1 or 2 on any floor to get the view of Old Quebec inside the walls).
The room itself was nice and comfortable and we were very happy with it. The hotel was close to everything and we could walk anywhere we wanted to see.
reviews.title: Perfect Location, Great Staff, Great Vacation

reviews.text: We chose this Hotel based on the reviews on TripAdvisor, and were so happy we did. The location can't be beat, as the entrance to Old Quebec is right outside the front door. The staff was the best we've encountered anywhere, even remembering our names and greeting us each time we came in. They also gave some great advice when we asked for recommendations for places to eat, and things to see. The valet parking made the stay convenient, as everything we wanted was within a five minute walk of the hotel. The room, with 2 queen beds was spacious, and interesting in it's layout, suitable for two adults and a child. The breakfast in the Hotel restaurant was excellent, and reasonably priced. Again, staff was great.
reviews.title: Very Good
Best Stay in Canada
reviews.text: If you go to Quebec and stay here, you won't be disappointed.

I stayed 2 nights at the Courtyard by Marriott. It is in a good location but it was difficult to find. It is not listed on many maps and it is close to only Old Quebec which you could see it all in half a day.
reviews.title: I loved this hotel!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is great place to stay in Quebec. It's just outside of the old city, so we could walk to the shops, restaurants, the Citiadel and the famous Chateau de Frontenac. The hotel feels more like a boutique hotel than a typical Courtyard. The staff was very friendly and the concierge was very helpful. I would highly recommend it to anyone wanting to travel to Quebec.
reviews.title: Great place to stay in Quebec

reviews.text: Spent 2 nights with my wife and 2 year old daughter. Used points and was upgraded to a suite given platinum status.
reviews.title: Very positive experience at hotel
Would stay here again.....
reviews.text: Very good experiencve at hotel as all reviews suggest. Still felt like a very nice Courtyard that a nice full service Marriott but that was fine with us.

reviews.title: Skating rink view
reviews.text: Pierre, the concierge, was excellent as was the entire front desk staff and general manager who greeted us upon arrival. Pierre booked a babysitter for us which worked out great and we also went to dinner after he made a reservation for Le Saint Amour- one of the top French restuarants in town.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Overall, very positive experience and would recommend to anyone. We had considered shelling out $300+ for a room at the Hotel Frontenac where we ended up going for a drink one night but glad we picked staying at the Courtyard.
reviews.title: Great hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We spent 4 nights at the Courtyard and really enjoyed our stay. There is not much more I could add that the other reviews (positive) have already commented on. The staff was helpful and treated you and everyone else as VIPs. We stayed in the Executive Suite which was very large for 2 people. It also had a 2 person (tight fit for 2) whirlpool which was great after walking all day. Tip: Go to Lush in Petite Champlain and get some fizzy bath balls. The room was very clean, quiet, bed was comfortable, and linens were in excellent condition. The hotel is easy to find, parking convenient and inexpensive (compared to Boston). You can’t beat the location being right outside the gate and close to the shops and many great restaurants. Plus you aren’t walking uphill or downhill to the hotel at the end of your day of exploring. The hotel restaurant is ok if you can’t get out. But there are plenty of options nearby – just ask the concierge for a suggestion. They recommended Le Hobbit to us and it was an affordable and delicious meal. There is a coffee shop next door for fresh coffee in the morning and close to a few grocery stories and wine shop on St. Jean. There was also a fridge in our room which we took advantage of for breakfast and snacks. If you are looking for a romantic setting, hip ambiance, or a retro bar setting, you’ll probably want to look at another hotel. Though I’d 100% recommend this hotel for value, convenience, and a comfortable stay. We will definitely go back for our next trip!
reviews.title: Comfortable, Relaxing, Affordable

reviews.text: I wanted tostay in Quebec City an additional day after my cruise ended and was glad I chose The Courtyard by Marriot Downtown Quebec City.
reviews.title: Good lodging fine service
Fabulous Hotel & Location
reviews.text: I disembarked the cruise ship at 9am and took a taxi to the hotel.
When I asked if they would keep my bags until check in time that afternoon the friendly front desk lady said they would not only hold my bags but place them in my room when it was made available.
reviews.title: Fantastic Hotel, cannot be faulted.

reviews.text: So with that taken care of I headed out into a sunny morning to see more of the city. The previous day I explored the lower city but now I just set out on foot to see the upper city.
reviews.title: Not your average Courtyard

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The highlights (in which there are no lowlights):
reviews.title: Fantastique!

likes.liked: — Location and exceptional quality of accomodation

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Location right outside the St. Jean gate to the walled city was awesome. Led you right into shops, cafes, pubs, restaurants etc.
reviews.title: C est si bon

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Great and convenient starting piont.
reviews.title: Customer Service at its Best!!

reviews.text: Location to train station very acessible (walkable, but a climb up or ride down depending on direction - cab was $5.00)
reviews.title: LOVED LOVED LOVED this hotel

reviews.text: Square that hotel surrounds had comedy festival going on and ice rink in the winter. Several play/event theatre's at your doorstep, several good cafes in the square and around the rear of hotel it is walkable to St. Jean street and numerous restaurants, pizza spots, liquor/wine shops and LA Maison grocery (which is awesome for local foods, meats,cheese's, picinic or eat-in stuff), as well as local drug/convenience stores for every need.
reviews.title: Wonderful Service and location

reviews.text: Wow. We stay at Marriotts all the time, including a stay in an "eh" Courtyard in Vermont the day before. We were blown away by everything about this place. It's right outside St. John's gate, close to several other cool neighborhoods. We are astounded that the AAA guidebook only rates this as 3 stars, it is clearly a top-notch 4 star. The building itself is beautiful and well maintained. We had a "junior suite" that was palatial with gorgeous views out the windows. The best thing about this hotel was the service--we've been in so-called 4 and 5 stars where customers get treated like dirt. Not here. Here EVERY single employee greets with a smile, EVERY employee follows up appropriately to be sure you are getting what you need, they were friendly, warm, helpful and efficient. We would name names, but that would be unfair to the many staff who treated us kindly in small ways but whose names we don't remember. Excellent stay, you really can't go wrong at this property.
reviews.title: Sublime!

reviews.text: As a Marriott Rewards Member I have stayed at many Marriott's around the globe. This was a very comfortable hotel more on the scale of a "boutique" hotel. Our party consisted of two adults, a teenager and a young child. The room size was more than adequate with extremely comfortable beds.
reviews.title: Excellent Service and Great Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff at the hotel were amongst the best I have ever experienced in terms of their friendliness and willingness to help out in any way possible.
reviews.title: Outstanding Service and Care

reviews.text: The location was perfect - right across from the old city and access to Rue St. Jean Baptiste - one of the main streets in Old Quebec - part of which was just a pedestrian street - shut down for vehicles.
reviews.title: Excellent service, location and accommodations

reviews.text: Note that the hotel does NOT validate your parking at the public parking lot located just a very short walk away (to the right of the hotel).
reviews.title: Wonderful stay at Marriott Courtyard

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: After reading good reviews on Trip Advisor (and I'm a Marriott Rewards member), My husband and I stayed three nights at this hotel in late August. We could not have picked a better place. The location was close to everything we wanted to see and do in the Old City, and it has a wonderful restaurant. The staff is young but extremely well trained, very helpful and totally bilingual. The concierge staff is obviously independent because I never heard them recommend their own restaurant, even though the food there is very good. We also got a great deal on the Marriott website - no charge for valet parking and a $25 Canada Petro card for each night we stayed there.
reviews.title: Great Location; Very Accomodating Staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Location is good, right on the doorstep of the Old Town. Found all of the staff cordial and helpful and everybody spoke English. My only quibble was the rooms are on the small size. Valet parking was $20 a day. Public parking right next door is $17 a day but with on in-out privleges.
reviews.title: Nice Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and were travelling for our 35th wedding anniversary. We checked out early from another hotel 8:00am and called the Marriott about a possible early Check-in. Normal check-in was 3:00pm. They told us our room would not be ready for awhile which we expected but they did everything possible to accomodate us and have us relax. They stowed our bags, parked our rental car and told us to enjoy the city until our room was ready. About 11:45 AM we received a call on my cell phone and were told that our room was ready and our baggage had been placed in the room. The room was overlooking the old city and the staff had a congratulatory anniversary card and a small box of chocolates awaiting our arrival. Very much appreciated and a nice touch for a chain hotel. The room was very clean (a little small) but nicely appointed. Terry cloth bath robes were provided for guests which is always a nice bathroom amenity. The staff was extraodinarily helpful in answering all of our questions suggesting restaurants' places of interest, tours and providing directions. The hotel is a few minute walk from the old city in fact the location makes you feel very much a part of Old Quebec City. We couldnt have enjoyed our stay more. The staff goes above and beyond the call of duty to insure a pleasurable stay.
reviews.title: Great Staff, Great Stay, Great Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We shall return!
reviews.title: Standard american hotel for an extraordinary city
A basic Courtyard Marriott for better or worse
reviews.text: Best feature about the hotel is location, just literally at the edge of one of the walls doors. It is out of the walled city just for a few steps. Ideally located for walking, the best ways to get know the city.

We stayed at the Courtyard Marriot in Quebec City for 3 nights. Loved the hotel - great location, nice rooms (only average bathrooms, but still very nice rooms overall) and very nice and helpful employees. One exception would be the concierge that "helped" us arrange a boat excursion – N.). We specifically told him that we were looking for a quick trip (1.5 hours) since we had a toddler with us, and he booked us into the 10:30 excursion on the Louis Jolliet with a bus pickup arranged for 10:00. All set, right?
reviews.title: Great hotel but mediocre concierge service

reviews.text: The Dupont Tours bus did show up at 10:00 am, picked us up and dropped us (and another 7 or 8 equally bewildered tourists) without any word of explanation to the docks by the correct ship around 10:25. Going to the ticket office on the dock to query why the ship was empty revealed that the ship was scheduled to depart at 11:30, not 10:30. Also, the return bus vouchers were for the 15:30 bus trip back, which would have left us waiting for the bus for a couple of hours after the boat returned around 13:00. The vouchers were also incorrect (listing the wrong number of people).
reviews.title: OK, but somewhat slack on security

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: When discussing this snafu with a different concierge in the evening (they rotate concierges and the concierge that made the arrangements was not going to be available until after we checked out), the second concierge confirmed that the trip was scheduled for 11:30 and expressed some mild concern over the bad bus vouchers and the misinformation provided to us by N.), but also made it clear that they do not consider that to be much of a mistake. We beg to differ, and are overall unhappy with the service we got from the concierge.
reviews.title: Surprisingly boutique-like hotel

reviews.text: Needless to say, our overall perception of the hotel is lower because of this incident. Due to the fact that everything else was great, we still recommend the hotel and the Louis Jolliet boat trip – we just recommend that you make sure that whichever concierge happens to be there that time provides you with the proper detail. Oh, and you might want to consider walking to the docks – it will take you less time to walk to Chateau Frontenac, take the funicular down and walk to the docks than it took the bus to drive us down.
reviews.title: Great location & service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: P. S. The Valet Parking is only 3 CAD more per day, and saves you money if you get in and out often enough - highly recommended.
reviews.title: Perfect Hotel
